definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: Debt collectors buy old debts from companies or lenders for pennies on the dollar.
sentences.chinese: 债主从公司收旧账或者跟债务人讨小钱。

sentences.english: May the creditor seize all his belongings and strangers plunder the fruits of his toil.
sentences.chinese: 使债主搜刮他所有的家产，使外人劫掠他劳力的所赚。

sentences.english: If robbers abounded, tax-gatherers and creditors had disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 如果盗贼蜂起，税使和债主就消失了。

sentences.english: A certain moneylender had two debtors; one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣说，一个债主，有两个人欠他的债。

sentences.english: A debtor is a slave to his creditor.
In fact, governments have made a habit of stiffing foreign creditors.
sentences.chinese: 事实是，各国政府已习惯了对外国债主赖帐。

sentences.english: Big Foot promises the creditors that he will take care of the debt.
sentences.chinese: 大脚答应债主自己会扛下所有的债务。

sentences.english: It can also protect against divorce, creditors and estate taxes.
sentences.chinese: 它也可以保护免于离婚，对抗债主和房产税。

sentences.english: He offering to lend source, but creditors, stalking rimmon goods move.
sentences.chinese: 玥主动借钱给源，但债主临门，要胁将货搬走。

sentences.english: We do not know who all of our creditors are.
sentences.chinese: 我们无法了知我们所有的冤亲债主。

sentences.english: In the summer of 1816, Percy was again fleeing his creditors.
sentences.chinese: 1816年的夏天，珀西为了躲避债主逃跑。

sentences.english: The poor stationer was at the mercy of those from whom he borrowed money.
sentences.chinese: 这可怜的文具商被他的债主们捏在了手心。

sentences.english: Creditors chasing the door by flesh, even the capital turnover are dubious.
sentences.chinese: 被债主追着上门讨债，连资金周转都成问题。

sentences.english: 42Neither of them had the money to pay him back, so he canceled the debts of both.
sentences.chinese: 因为他们无力偿还，债主就开恩免了他们两个人的债。

sentences.english: The cunning female moneylender suggested that they let Providence decide the matter.
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的女债主建议，让上帝来决定这件事。

sentences.english: He managed to stall off his creditor.
sentences.chinese: 他设法把债主搪塞过去了。

definition: to owe a debt/the sum owed
to press for payment of debts/to dun
to demand payment/to collect overdue payment
to demand payment of money owing
